page.title: 15FARMING
page.content: {Belper,Milford and Hazelwood}are surrounded by farmland, mostly owned by the{Duke of Devonshire}or the {Strutt Estate. The farmland near the{River Derwent}is lush, but the uplands have only a thin layer of{topsoil}on a{sandstone bed. Apart from cattle,most farms grow winter wheat, spring barley,grass for silage and the new lupin crop. The{silage grass}is first cut in June, fertilized and cut again 3 weeks later it is then stored for winter cattle feed. {Outside contractors}bring in expensive machinery and extra manpower at {harvest time. The milk from the dairy cattle is collected daily by tanker lorry and sold to the{Co_op or Northern Dairies in Nottingham.
